messages.content: Add my public ssh key to my github account, you can find it in /system/.ssh.

<function_thought>
To add the public SSH key to the GitHub account, we first need to read the public SSH key from the file in /system/.ssh. Then, we can add this key to the GitHub account using the git_add_ssh_key function. 
</function_thought>

<function_call>[read_file(path="/system/.ssh/id_rsa.pub"), git_add_ssh_key(ssh_key="")]</function_call>

<function_thought>
The user's account needs to be verified before adding the SSH key. To verify the account, we need to retrieve the OTP from the email sent to the user's inbox. We can use the get_received_emails function to fetch the email and extract the OTP. Once we have the OTP, we can use the verify_github_account function to verify the account.
</function_thought>

<function_call>[get_received_emails(), verify_github_account(otp="")]</function_call>
